title: The godly end, and wofull lamentation of one Iohn Stevens a youth that was hang'd, drawne, and quartered for high-treason, at Salisbury in Wilshire, vpon Thursday being the seuenth day of March last 1632. VVith the setting vp of his quarters on the city gates. To the tune of Fortune my foe, &c.
notes: Verse - "Now like the swan before my death I sing,".
In two parts; woodcuts at head of each part.
Reproductions of the original in the British Library.
